intro: Euphorbia distans, commonly known as the "Cape Honeysuckle" or "Cape Honeysuckle Euphorbia," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a thick, branching stem with small, waxy leaves that are often blue-green in color. The plant produces striking yellow-orange cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements contribute to its appeal among succulent enthusiasts.
